etymologies: late 17th century (as a verb): of unknown origin

definitions: a small wave or series of waves on the surface of water, especially as caused by an object dropping into it or a slight breeze

examples.text: he dived into the pool leaving barely a ripple
the ripples spread across the pond

shortDefinitions: small wave or series of waves on surface of water

definitions: a thing resembling a ripple or ripples in appearance or movement

examples.text: the sand undulated and was ridged with ripples

shortDefinitions: thing resembling ripple or ripples in appearance or movement

definitions: a gentle rising and falling sound, especially of laughter or conversation, that spreads through a group of people

examples.text: a ripple of laughter ran around the room

shortDefinitions: gentle rising and falling sound that spreads through group of people

definitions: a particular feeling or effect that spreads through someone or something

examples.text: his words set off a ripple of excitement within her

shortDefinitions: particular feeling or effect that spreads through person or thing

definitions: a wave on a fluid surface, the restoring force for which is provided by surface tension rather than gravity, and which consequently has a wavelength shorter than that corresponding to the minimum speed of propagation.
shortDefinitions: wave on fluid surface, restoring force

definitions: small periodic, usually undesirable, variations in electrical voltage superposed on a direct voltage or on an alternating voltage of lower frequency
shortDefinitions: small periodic variations in electrical voltage superposed on direct voltage

definitions: a type of ice cream with wavy lines of colored flavored syrup running through it
shortDefinitions: type of ice cream with wavy lines of coloured flavoured syrup

definitions: (of water) form or flow with a series of small waves on the surface
shortDefinitions: form or flow with small waves on surface

definitions: cause (the surface of water) to form small waves

examples.text: a cool wind rippled the surface of the estuary

shortDefinitions: cause surface of water to form small waves

definitions: move in a way resembling a series of small waves

examples.text: fields of grain rippling in the wind

shortDefinitions: move in way resembling small waves

definitions: (of a sound or feeling) spread through a person, group, or place
shortDefinitions: (of sound or feeling) spread through person or place
